newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: At least 20 dead in Venezuelan jail fire.
newsitem.headline: At least 20 dead in Venezuelan jail fire.

text.p: At least 20 inmates were killed early on Tuesday when a fire apparently caused by prison guards broke out in a Venezuelan jail, Justice Minister Henrique Meier said.

"There are 20 dead, but it could be more," Meier told Reuters. He said the fire at the La Planta jail on the southwestern outskirts of the capital started when National Guardsmen closed off a wing of the prison and threw in tear gas canisters.
Meier said it was unclear why the guards had locked up the prisoners and said an investigation would be launched into the causes of the fire.
"It has to be studied. But it wouldn't make sense for the prisoners to start the fire themselves unless they wanted to commit suicide," he said.
The minister could not confirm radio and television reports that guards had also opened fire on the prisoners but added that the situation at the jail was now under control.
Venezuela's overcrowded and decaying prisons are frequent scenes of violence between inmates and clashes with guards. La Planta was built for 300 prisoners but currently holds about 900.
